title: Belgium 9-0 San Marino: Lukaku nets 50th for Red Devils as Martinez's side qualify for Euro 2020
text:
Romelu Lukaku scored his 50th international goal as Belgium thrashed San Marino 9-0 on Thursday and became the first side through to the Euro 2020 finals, with Russia on the verge of joining them after seeing off Scotland 4-0 in Moscow.

Unbeaten Belgium have 21 points from seven games, with only one goal conceded, with Russia on 18 and Cyprus, 2-1 winners over Kazakhstan in Astana, on 10. The top two in each group qualify directly.

San Marino managed to keep a clean sheet for 27 minutes against the top-ranked 2018 World Cup semi-finalists before, as expected, the Group I floodgates opened at Brussels's King Baudouin stadium.

Romelu Lukaku became the first player to score 50 goals for Belgium on Thursday night

Belgium striker Lukaku opened the scoring with a right-footed shot in the 28th minute

Lukaku grabbed his second goal on 41 minutes assisted by Real Madrid's Eden Hazard

MATCH FACTS Belgium: Courtois, Alderweireld, Vermaelen, Vertonghen, Castagne, Vanaken, Tielemans, Chadli, Mertens (Verschaeren 63), Lukaku (Benteke 76), Eden Hazard (Carrasco 63). Subs Not Used: Batshuayi, Sels, Mechele, Thorgan Hazard, Boyata, Januzaj, Origi, Witsel, Teunckens. Booked: Mertens. Goals: Lukaku 28, Chadli 31, Brolli 35 og, Lukaku 41, Grandoni 43 og, Tielemans 45, Benteke 79, Verschaeren 84 pen, Castagne 90. San Marino: Benedettini, Battistini, Brolli, Davide Simoncini, Palazzi, Grandoni (Lunadei 78), Mularoni, Enrico Golinucci, Giardi (Jose Hirsch 46),Nanni, Filippo Berardi (Alessandro Golinucci 46). Subs Not Used: D'Addario, Ceccaroli, Della Valle, Gasperoni, Zavoli, Bernardi, Censoni, Aldo Simoncini, Tomassini. Booked: Mularoni, Davide Simoncini.

Inter Milan striker Lukaku became the first Belgian to reach a half century of international goals with a right-footed shot to open the scoring.

He then set up Nacer Chadli three minutes later before an own-goal from Cristian Brolli put Belgium 3-0 up in the 35th. Lukaku then grabbed his second on 41 minutes assisted by Real Madrid's Eden Hazard.

A deflected Toby Alderweireld effort in the 43rd minute and a Youri Tielemens shot in stoppage time saw Belgium cruise in 6-0 up at the break.

The pace slowed before Christian Benteke scored in the 79th, three minutes after coming on, wrong-footing the goalkeeper from the edge of the area.

Yari Verschaeren made it 8-0 from the penalty spot in the 84th and Timothy Castagne rounded off the tally in the 90th minute.

Russia dominated possession at the Luzhniki stadium but were frustrated throughout the first half by a Scotland side that failed to muster a single shot on target.

Inter Milan striker set up Nacer Chadli before an own-goal from Cristian Brolli made it 3-0

Defender Toby Alderweireld got on the scoresheet with a deflected effort in the 43rd minute

The Scots, who can no longer qualify automatically but remain in contention through the playoffs, crumbled after the break.

Artem Dzyuba made the breakthrough for Russia on the volley in the 57th and a second followed three minutes later when Magomed Ozdoev blasted a long-range screamer past David Marshall.

Dzyuba headed in his second in the 70th minute, with an Aleksandr Golovin shot going in off the post in the 84th, as Russia cruised to a comfortable win.

A Youri Tielemens shot in stoppage time saw Belgium cruise in 6-0 up at the break

Midfielder Yari Verschaeren made it 8-0 from the penalty spot in the 84th minute
description: Romelu Lukaku scored his 50th international goal as Belgium thrashed San Marino on Thursday and became the first side through to the Euro 2020 finals.
